benchmark_details.name: Schema Lineage Composite Evaluation (SLiCE)
benchmark_details.overview: The Schema Lineage Composite Evaluation (SLiCE) is a novel metric introduced for automated extraction of schema lineage from multilingual enterprise pipeline scripts. It evaluates the structural correctness and semantic fidelity of the extracted lineage, utilizing a benchmark of 1,700 manually annotated schema lineages from real-world scripts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic evaluation framework for schema lineage extraction from complex, multilingual data pipelines.

data.source: Manually annotated schema lineages from 50 enterprise pipeline scripts in SQL, Python, and C#.

methodology.calculation: SLiCE combines multiple evaluations (format correctness, source schema match, source table evaluation, transformation, and aggregation evaluations) into a single composite score.
methodology.interpretation: Scores express the accuracy of lineage extraction, where 1.0 indicates perfect extraction.
methodology.baseline_results: Models evaluated include various open-source small language models (SLMs) and large language models (LLMs), with results indicating model scaling improvements.
methodology.validation: Experimentally validated through extensive evaluation on a curated dataset.
